title: Resources

Here are a selection of resources available to help with this course as well as more generally with cognitive modeling and RStan.

## Textbooks

<div style="font-size: 22px;"><strong>R Programming</strong></div>
<div style="height: 16px;"></div>

Kabacoff, R. (2015). R in Action, 2nd Ed. Manning Publications.

Wickham, H., & Grolemund, G. (2017). R for Data Science. O'Reilly Media.

<div style="font-size: 22px;"><strong>General statistics</strong></div>
<div style="height: 16px;"></div>

Poldrack, R. A. (2019). Statistical Thinking for the 21st Century. [http://statsthinking21.org/](http://statsthinking21.org/)

<div style="font-size: 22px;"><strong>Bayesian statistics and modeling in Stan</strong></div>
<div style="height: 16px;"></div>

Lambert, B. (2018). A Student's Guide to Bayesian Statistics. Sage.

McElreath, R. (2020). Statistical Rethinking: A Bayesian Course with Examples in R and Stan, 2nd Ed. CRC Press.

Kruschke, J. K. (2015). Doing Bayesian Data Analysis: A Tutorial with R, JAGS, and Stan, 2nd Ed. Academic Press.

Pruim, R. (2019). (Re)Doing Bayesian data analysis. [https://rpruim.github.io/Kruschke-Notes/](https://rpruim.github.io/Kruschke-Notes/)

Gelman, A., Carlin, J. B., Stern, H. S., Dunson, D. B., Vehtari, A., & Rubin, D. B. (2013). Bayesian Data Analysis, 3rd Ed. Chapman and Hall/CRC.

:::{.callout-tip title="Which textbook should I start with?"}
It is recommended that beginners to Bayesian statistics should work their way down from this list starting with *A Student's Guide to Bayesian Statistics*, whilst those with some experience should start with *Statistical Rethinking: A Bayesian Course with Examples in R and Stan*.
:::

<div style="font-size: 22px;"><strong>Cognitive modeling</strong></div>
<div style="height: 16px;"></div>

Farrell, S., & Lewandowsky, S. (2018). Computational Modeling of Cognition and Behavior. Cambridge University Press.

Lee, M. D., & Wagenmakers, E. J. (2014). Bayesian Cognitive Modeling: A Practical Course. Cambridge University Press.

## Online cognitive modeling tutorials 

- [Neuromatch Academy Computational Neuroscience Course](https://compneuro.neuromatch.io/tutorials/intro.html) A wide-spanning curriculum that covers most areas of computational neuroscience (Python based).
- [Behavioural Modeling](https://hannekedenouden.ruhosting.nl/RLtutorial/Instructions.html) A two-part course covering how to model cognitive behaviour using MATLAB. By Hanneke den Ouden (Donders Institute, Nijmegen) and Jill O'Reilly (Oxford University).
- [Computational Models of Human Social Behavior and Neuroscience](https://shawnrhoads.github.io/gu-psyc-347/index.html) An introductory course to the computational modeling of social behaviour for those with no prior programming experience needed (Python based). By Shawn Rhoads (Icahn School of Medicine).
- [NivStan](https://nivlab.github.io/nivstan/) A guide to getting started in Stan with tutorials written by the Niv Lab at Princeton (uses PyStan, the Python interface to Stan).

## Websites

- [The Stan Forums](https://discourse.mc-stan.org): the community hub where users can ask questions, share code, and discuss implementation details of Stan models
- [DataCamp](https://www.datacamp.com/): a resource for interactive online courses that cover Bayesian statistics and Stan programming
- [The distribution zoo](https://ben18785.shinyapps.io/distribution-zoo/): an interactive tool to build intuitions about common probability distributions.
- [Probability distribution explorer](https://distribution-explorer.github.io/): another interactive tool on probability distributions, with code in Python and Stan.
- [Michael Betancourt's blog post](https://betanalpha.github.io/writing/): comprehensive case studies using Stan.
